statement.p: In Preview Activity, we reasoned graphically to sketch the derivative of g(x) = 2^x. The following questions remind us of some key ideas related to sketching the graph of the derivative, given a graph of the original function.

li.p: Let q(x) = 2 - (x-1)^2, and use a graphing utility to plot this quadratic function. At what value(s) of x is q'(x) = 0? For what values of x is q'(x) positive? For what values of x is q'(x) negative?

Let f(x) = \sin(x), and use a graphing utility to plot this trigonometric function. State 3 values of x for which f'(x) = 0. What is one interval values of x on which f'(x) positive? What is one interval of values of x on which f'(x) negative?

Let g(x) = \cos(x), and use a graphing utility to plot this trigonometric function. State 3 values of x for which g'(x) = 0. What is one interval values of x on which x is g'(x) positive? What is one interval values of x on which g'(x) is negative?
